programme.title: Histoire(s) de jardins
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Tendance XXI
programme.desc:
Season 7, episode 1:

An in-depth look at the secrets of the French luxury industry, and earrings for men. The Marseilles collective Laissez Passer recycles below-standard and abandoned harbour materials. How to wear satin, whatever the occasion. The association Fleurs d'Halage offers a second life to polluted areas of Paris.

Commentary by: Viviane Blassel.

programme.title: Curieux Bégin
programme.desc: 1980s inspirations We rediscover the culinary culture of the 1980s with our idols: Mario Pelchat, Martine St-Clair and Sonia Benezra. The chef Julien Phavorachith explores the emblematic dishes of the day. Presenter: Christian Bégin.

programme.title: Cédric Kahn, l'échappée
programme.desc: We head off on a journey with French actor and director Cédric Kahn, a voyage to explore the settings for some of his films. From one encounter to another, he leads us towards what lies at the very heart of his cinema. Directed by: Alexandre Hilaire (France, 2022)

programme.title: Les nouveaux nomades
programme.desc: Éric heads to Béarn and the largest colony of vultures in the Pyrenees. In Saint-Nazaire, Julie visits the famous Atlantic shipyards. Cyril has discovered a delicious sweet treat near Saumur: a dried pear known as a "poire tapée". In Champagne, Carine immerses herself in the history of Lake Der. Presented by: Éric Perrin, Julie Hattu, Cyril Hue, Carine Aigon.

programme.title: Épicerie fine, terroirs gourmands
programme.desc: The Haut-Doubs In the heart of the Haut-Doubs, Anne-Sophie and Arnaud Bourgeois make a liqueur with a demonic reputation: absinthe. Antoine Vernerey produces Comté, an age-old variety of AOC cheese. Geneviève Magnon excavates peat bogs for a veritable journey back in time. Focus on an exceptional product: the Morteau sausage. Presented by: Guy Martin.

programme.title: Ça roule en cuisine
programme.desc: "Côté vigne" Sophie Menut is in Alsace, aiming for Kientzheim, where she will meet two sisters, Anne-Cécile and Marie. It's mid-November: Anne-Cécile is waiting for her in the vineyard, ready for the late harvest, while Marie is expecting her in her "Côté vigne" restaurant, poised to cook a roasted pineapple cookie with chocolate chantilly. Presentation: Sophie Menut.

programme.title: La recette de Guy Martin
programme.sub-title: Filet d'agneau farci à l'ail des ours et gnocchis aux olives et thym
programme.desc: Fillet of lamb with wild garlic stuffing and olive and thyme gnocchi The Michelin-starred chef Guy Martin presents products emblematic of France and suggests a recipe to prepare them. Presented by: Guy Martin.

programme.title: Passe-moi les jumelles
programme.desc:
We discover the fascinating world of blowing glass through a tube, with Valérie de Roquemaurel, the only Swiss woman to practice the art. Then dive into the world of the truffle in the northern Vaud with local enthusiasts, the truffle "cavers".
Presented by: Matthieu Fournier.

programme.title: 5 chefs dans ma cuisine
programme.sub-title: Ragoût de gourganes et de morue
programme.desc: Stewed broad beans and cod Arnaud Marchand prepares a dish based on local produce by cooking a rich stew of gourgane broad beans and cod, served with a cream, gin and juniper berry sauce. Presented by: Marina Orsini. Directed by: Nicole Dussault, David Gauthier, Stéphane Rocheleau, Léo Boulanger (Canada, 2020)

programme.title: Thalassa
programme.desc: La Rochelle's Lycée Maritime has been training sailors since 1655. Today, it prepares students for a wide range of professions linked to the sea. We then head off to meet the captain of the training ship "Shtandart", hit by the European directives restricting access for Russian ships to European ports. Presented by: Sabine Quindou.

programme.title: Alain Resnais, l'audacieux
programme.desc:
An eccentric, disconcerting film-maker, brilliant inventor of new styles. In the shadows of the New Wave, Alain Resnais (1922-2014) left an indelible mark on European cinema. "On Connaît la Chanson", "L'Année Dernière à Marienbad", "Hiroshima Mon Amour"... A look back at the career of a discreet nonconformist.

Directed by: Pierre-Henri Gibert (France, 2022)

programme.title: Ô la belle vie
programme.desc: The Petite Camargue, proud and intrepid A journey through the Petite Camargue, where the Rhône meets the Mediterranean, one of Europe's largest wetland reserves. The Camargue: home to herds of white horses galloping through the marshes, massive black bulls, vast stretches of water shared by flamingos and other water birds. Plus so many other fabulous surprises... Presented by: Sophie Jovillard.

programme.title: Silence, ça pousse !
programme.desc:
Programme summary: Baptiste Saulnier, gardener at the Château de Chambord; vegetable oils for the cosmetics industry; the landscapes of the Camargue.
Presented by: Stéphane Marie, Carole Tolila.

programme.title: Pistes vertes
programme.desc: Visit to an animal farm at Vauville in the Manche. Encounter with Christophe, a baker who produces his own wheat and flour. In Seine-Maritime, Audrey and Thomas have opened a gite in their garden to encourage biodiversity. Maxime, a cabinet maker, creates furniture using reclaimed wood. Presenter: Laurent Quembre.

programme.title: Version Française
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: La main à la pâte
programme.desc: Cheese from Kelowna In Kelowna, the master cheese-maker Sandra produces a range of cow and goat milk cheeses which delight food lovers. Wearing his hairnet, Luc discovers their production secrets. Presenter: Luc Jean.

programme.title: L'art et la matière
programme.sub-title: Faïencerie de Gien/Porter la ceinture et le motif à fleurs
programme.desc: Pas de description

programme.title: Pays et marchés du monde
programme.desc: Bora-Bora (Polynésie française) Découverte des marchands des bords de route de Bora-Bora. Présentation : Xavier Petit.

programme.title: Passe-moi les jumelles
programme.desc:

Presented by: Matthieu Fournier.

programme.desc: Lobster with kabu turnips and brocciu cheese, honey and rosemary vinaigrette The Michelin-starred chef Guy Martin presents products emblematic of France and suggests a recipe to prepare them. Presented by: Guy Martin.
